author: tvih
title: Massive army builder!
review:
As a Castle fan I just had to get this when I saw it. A lot of soldiers for not so steep a price? Yes please!

Pros

  • Lots of soldiers for each side
  • Green Dragons now get a sort of official leader too!
  • Lots of shields for once!
  • Mostly nice weapons, especially all the axes
  • Pieces won't be displaced if you put the game aside for a while with the game in progress

Cons

  • I'm not sure why they made the rooks actual towers instead of mini figures, it's sort of disappointing - but at least you get big shields from them for army purposes
  • If you actually play chess with the set, it can feel a bit crowded trying to move the figures 
  • The flails don't look that good (would've preferred swords), same with the very plasticky-looking corseques
  • Could've used some neck protector helmets on the pawns perhaps?
  • The Jesters aren't that nice if you're using this as an army-builder set instead of chess set
  • Kind of unfortunate that the Green Dragon pawns all have the silly face
  • The outer plastic stuff with the towers etc is kinda ugly, would be much nicer if it was built from bricks - though I suppose those willing to pay the extra can just get the bricks and do it for themselves!

I listed a lot of cons, but honestly they're very minor things compared to the good stuff. This set is a great value for money given how many figures you get, and works great as an army builder set, while also being usable for chess.
